p: Even though ERAPs share virtually 50% sequence homology and their function can be fulfilled through heterodimer formation, different studies indicated that the evolution of these two genes is different [ 4]. Indeed, ERAP1 has a homolog in mice which is called ER aminopeptidase associated with antigen processing (ERAAP), while ERAP2 has no homolog in rodents and possibly it is the result of a rather recent duplication of the ERAP1 gene [ 21].
